game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameObject
      • game.Player

  • public class Player
extends GameObject
    This is the class that will handle player game logic and rendering.
    Author:
    Clayton Nida

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              int id,
              java.lang.String character,
              java.lang.String name,
              int stock,
              Handler handler)
        The player constructor will take all info passed to it from the Game constructor and assemble the player based on this info. It will then load all the correct arrays of images that will be used for animation.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the player when constructed.
        y - The y location of the player when constructed.
        id - The ID of the player. To help associate them from others.
        character - The character the the player will be using.
        name - The user name of the player.
        stock - The number of lives this player will have.
        handler - The handler that will be used to loop through all game objects.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        This is the method that will be called to "tick" the object. Each object will have different logic that will be used after tick is called.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        This will be used to draw the images needed. Depending on each GameObject, different things will be rendered. Example: players will have their models rendered, and level will have maps and platforms rendered.
        Specified by:
        render in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        g - The given Graphics object that will be used to draw/render all images.

      • detectCollision

        private void detectCollision(GameObject player)
        Cycle through the list of GameObjects, and check if their hitboxs intersect with the one passed into this method. If so, call the doCollision(GameObject go) method.
        Parameters:
        player - The player we are using to detect collision with.

      • detectCollision

        private void detectCollision(java.awt.Rectangle attack)
        Cycle through the list of GameObjects, and check if their hitboxs intersect with the one passed into this method. If so, call the doAttackCollision(GameObject go) method.
        Parameters:
        attack - The rectangle that we are checking to see if colliding with anyone.

      • doCollision

        private void doCollision(GameObject player)
        This is the method that is called if ever two or more players collide.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that will be moved due to collision.

      • doAttackCollision

        private void doAttackCollision(GameObject player)
        This is the method that is called if ever one player successfully attacks another.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that will be damaged due to collision.

      • hasLanded

        private void hasLanded()
        This method uses a small rectangle under the player and checks to see if it has intersected with any of the rectangles representing the platforms or ground. If so, we allow the player to jump more.

      • drawOutOfBoundsIndicator

        private void drawOutOfBoundsIndicator(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                                      int x,
                                      int y)
        This will draw a circle on screen, if the player ever goes off screen, in the relative location that player is currently.
        Parameters:
        graphics - Given graphics object that will be used to draw with.
        x - X location of the circle to be drawn.
        y - Y location of the circle to be drawn.
